title: Reported speech: questions
introduction: Do you know how to report a question that somebody asked? Test what you know with interactive exercises and read the explanation to help you.
explanation: A reported question is when we tell someone what another person asked. To do this, we can use direct speech or indirect speech.

Do you know how to report a question that somebody asked?
Look at these examples to see how we can tell someone what another person asked.
A reported question is when we tell someone what another person asked.
He asked me if I was going to the Helsinki conference.
She asked us whether we'd finished the project yet.
The most common reporting verb for questions is ask, but we can also use verbs like enquire, want to know or wonder.
He wondered when we could get it done by.
